result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcos Antonio Degro Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Less Than $2,500 Damage) [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 96 DAYS served.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA and DV surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation. any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
The Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim.
No weapons.

Mental Health Assessment.
Batterer's Intervention Program.

AODA Assessment and other counseling needs to be determined.
Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: As to Count 1: Perform 12 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcos Antonio Degro Jr

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction; Concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 96 DAYS served.  

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction; Concurrent with COUNT 1, with credit for 96 DAYS served.  

Court STAYED sentences and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and DV surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
AODA Assessment and other counseling needs to be determined.
Mental Health Assessment. 
Seek and maintain full-time employment.
AS TO COUNT 1: Perform 12 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
No contact with victim.
Batterer's Intervention Course.
No weapons. 

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Marcos Antonio Degro in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Marcos Antonio Degro in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 10. Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and upon motion of the state, the Court ordered COUNT 3 DISMISSED AND READ IN for the purposes of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by the parties to criminal complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint. Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Marcos Antonio Degro not in court, in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense was received a new offer and is requesting a plea and sentencing date before the jury trial date. Jury trial date will remain on the Court's calendar until a plea is entered. Case is adjourned to 6-3-22 at 2:00 pm for plea and sentencing in person in room 504 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Marcos Antonio Degro not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 4-22-22 at 10:30 am for final pretrial and 6-8-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Ashley O. or her residence.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $2,500.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No contact order monitoring only.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Marcos Antonio Degro in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Marcos Antonio Degro in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
